items.sentence: I thought I\'d made my feelings about Tom perfectly clear.
I wasn\'t very sleepy, so I stayed up and watched a movie.
I\'d like you to go to the supermarket and buy some bread.
I didn\'t say anything because I didn\'t know what to say.
I didn\'t tell Tom why I wasn\'t going to be at his party.
As is often the case with him, he didn\'t show up on time.
Tom certainly didn\'t do as good a job as he usually does.
Tom is convinced that his mother doesn\'t want to eat now.
Tom knew Mary wouldn\'t even consider coming over to help.
I never for a moment imagined that Tom would be convicted.
I trained my dog to bring me the newspaper in the morning.
Give me a few minutes and I\'ll find out what\'s going on.
There\'s only one way to find out how to do that. Ask Tom.
These flowers aren\'t only beautiful, but they smell nice.
I\'d be very surprised if Tom isn\'t at the party tonight.
It\'s been a long time since we\'ve had such nice weather.
Could you please take care of my dog while I\'m in Boston?
Do you know what to do if there\'s a fire in the building?
Tom and I aren\'t the only ones here who can speak French.
I wish I could come up with a good answer to the question.
I wish I could explain to you how important this is to me.
I wonder whether Tom has ever asked Mary why she did that.
I\'ll send you a copy of that picture as soon as possible.
I\'m afraid we must go if we want to get home before dark.
I\'m meeting Tom for lunch at a restaurant on Park Street.
I\'m not interested in learning how to fix a broken table.
I\'m very interested in listening to what you have to say.
I\'ve already written everything that needs to be written.
I don\'t care what anyone says. I think Tom is a nice guy.
I don\'t have time to do everything that needs to be done.
I don\'t have time to say this twice, so listen carefully.
I don\'t know what Tom told you, but it might not be true.
I don\'t really want to wear a tie to work, but I have to.
I don\'t think Tom knows what time I woke up this morning.
You\'re one of the most interesting people I\'ve ever met.
Tom didn\'t want to go outside without his hat and gloves.
Tom has gone to get a haircut, but he should be back soon.
Tom played the oboe and Mary accompanied him on the piano.
Tom ran and ran, until at last he saw the telephone booth.
Tom worked in the garden for several hours this afternoon.
Why don\'t you do something useful and get me some coffee?
You can come and see me whenever it\'s convenient for you.
You have wanted to go there for a long time, haven\'t you?
I haven\'t told the kids yet that we\'re getting divorced.
I\'m pretty sure that Tom and Mary don\'t know each other.
I\'m the only one in this group who doesn\'t speak French.
Tom said he wanted me to be at the meeting this afternoon.
Tom takes a shower every morning before he goes to school.
Tom never expected that Mary would fall in love with John.
Tom never forgave himself for hurting Mary the way he did.
